member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.Action
member.summary: A multi-purpose delegate to use when you need neither parameters nor a return value.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepChangedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Guid)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent
member.summary: Sine amplitude sweep waveform component. Runs with constant frequency, from amplitude to another, during given duration. Then jumps to start starting amplitude again.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.CreateCopy
member.summary: Create a copy of the amplitude sine sweep component.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.DurationMs
member.summary: Duration of sine sweep in ms. Runs from starting amplitude to end amplitude during this duration.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.Enabled
member.summary: Is the sweep component included in calculation of the output signal

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of this instance.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioInput class.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bits are allocated per sample. Supported values are 8 and 16. If other value is used, 16 is used instead. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Connect(System.Object,Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.DataGeneratedEventHandler,Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.StartedEventHandler,Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.StoppedEventHandler)
member.summary: Connects this AudioInput instance to a target object that has at least one of the three event handlers defined.
member.param: Target object that this AudioInput instance is connected with.
member.returns: True if connection was created succesfully. Otherwise false.

member.name: E:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.DataGenerated
member.summary: Occurs when new data has been generated.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Disconnect(System.Object)
member.summary: Disconnects a target object from this AudioInput instance.
member.returns: True if target object was diconnected succesfully. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.GetRecordingDevices
member.summary: Returns a list of RecordingDeviceInfo objects that describe available Windows recording devices.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.IsInputEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of this instance (i.e. starts or stops it). Setting this property true is the same as calling Start method where false is the same as calling Stop method. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.IsStereo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use two channels (stereo) or just one (mono). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.RecordingDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets the current recording device. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. By setting this property null, Windows' default recording device is used. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: Get or sets sampling frequency. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Start
member.summary: Starts this instance. Is equivalent to setting IsInputEnabled property true.

member.name: E:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Started
member.summary: Occurs when audio input has been started.

member.name: E:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Stopped
member.summary: Occurs when audio input has been stopped.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.StopRequest
member.summary: Signals this instance to stop. Stopping does not occur immediately after exiting this method. By subscribing to Stopped event, caller is notified when everything has stopped. Is equivalent to setting IsInputEnabled property true.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.ThreadInvoking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this instance automatically synchronizes its events to the main UI thread hence eliminating the need to call Dispatcher.Invoke method on caller's side. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioInput.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets volume (0-100). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioOutput class.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.AddSamples(System.Double[][])
member.summary: Use this method to feed new data to audio output stream.
member.param: Samples to be fed to audio output stream ([Channel][Sample]).

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets audio playback balance. Valid values are between -100 to 100. -100 means that audio is played only through the left speaker. 0 means that both speakers output audio. 100 means that audio is played only through the right speaker. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bits are allocated per sample. Supported values are 8 and 16. If other value is used, 16 is used instead. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.IsOutputEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of this instance (i.e. starts or stops it). Setting this property true is the same as calling Start method where false is the same as calling Stop method. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.IsStereo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use two channels (stereo) or just one (mono). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.PlaybackDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets the current playback device. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. By setting this property null, Windows' default playback device is used. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets sampling frequency. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.Start
member.summary: Starts this instance. Is equivalent to setting IsOutputEnabled property true.

member.name: E:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.Started
member.summary: Occurs when audio playback has been started.

member.name: E:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.Stopped
member.summary: Occurs when audio playback has been stopped.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.StopRequest
member.summary: Signals this instance to stop. Stopping does not occur immediately after exiting this method. By subscribing to Stopped event, caller is notified when everything has stopped. Is equivalent to setting IsOutputEnabled property true.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.AudioOutput.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets volume (0-100). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.summary: Constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.DataGeneratedEventArgs.FirstSampleTimeStamp
member.summary: Timestamp when a first sample occured.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FilterRoutines.MovingAverage(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Moving (floating) average. Smoothens the given data by calculating an average based on used value and its neighbor values.
member.param: Averaging window length. Calculates output as average of each value and neighbors in range - windowLength / 2...+ windowLength / 2

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FIRFilter.CanOutput
member.summary: This is set true by the filter after at least samples of delay have been fed to filter. The delay is the filter tap factor length / 2. This is a public variable because of performance reasons.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FIRFilter.FilterData(System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Filters an array of data. Cannot be used inside Paraller.For loop.
member.param: Array of data to be filtered.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FIRFilter.GetDelay
member.summary: Get delay of filter as samples.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FIRFilter.GetFactors
member.summary: Gets the array of filter factors.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.FIRFilter.Reset
member.summary: Reset filter internal delay line and states.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.IIRFilter.#ctor(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: Filter factor table. Minimum value allowed for the outputMaximum value allowed for the output. If the output value is not withing the range, filtering methods return UnstableIIR status The first half contains numerators and the second half denominators.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.IIRFilter.#ctor(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Makes an IIR filter from coefficients. H(z) = B(z)/A(z).

member.returns: False if unstable filter, otherwise true

member.param: Factor array of nums and denoms

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of SignalGenerator class.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.Factor
member.summary: Get or sets a general factor for output signal. Allows using e.g. millivolt range by setting this 0.001, or 1E-3. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.GeneratorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this signal generator. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.IsGeneratorEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of this generator (enabled or not). This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.MasterGenerator
member.summary: Master generator. Several generators can be combined together to produce a synchronized multi-channel output data stream. Master sets the sampling frequency for each slave generator and combines the samples from each slave to master's output data stream. Set this null if this is a master generator.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.MultiCoreProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether multi-core processing is enabled. If enabled, computes the signal in multiple threads. Enables faster rendering when CPU has more cores than 1. Only certain parts of chart are multicore optimized. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.OutputInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the output interval of this generator in milliseconds. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.SamplingFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling frequency, i.e. the number of output points generated per second. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.ThreadInvoking
member.summary: Built-in invoking to UI thread when using ThreadType = Thread.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.ThreadType
member.summary: Gets or sets the way how data is generated. Generates data either by using a thread or a main UI thread synchronized timer.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformAmplitudeSweepSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine sweep amplitude component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformFrequencySweepSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine sweep amplitude component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformRandomNoises
member.summary: Get or sets random noise waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformSquares
member.summary: Get or sets square waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalGenerator.WaveformTriangles
member.summary: Get or sets triangle waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of SignalReader class.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets how many bits are for one sample.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.Caption
member.summary: Gets/sets optional caption for signal reader. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.Factor
member.summary: General factor for output signal. Allows using for example millivolt range by setting this 0.001, or 1E-3. This is a dependency propety.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.FileFilterString
member.summary: Filter string for file open dialog.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.FileName
member.summary: Gets/sets the name (full path) of the data file. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.FileSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the source file in bytes.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.IsLooping
member.summary: Get/sets whether reading should continue from the beginning of the data file after end-of-file has been reached. Possible file header is skipped. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.IsReaderEnabled
member.summary: Get/sets whether this instance is running or not. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the source file in samples (for each channel). For some file formats, this is an estimate.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.OutputInterval
member.summary: Output interval in milliseconds. This is only the target value and not always accurate. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.SamplingFrequency
member.summary: Gets sampling frequency. The count of output points calculated per second.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.ThreadInvoking
member.summary: Gets/sets whether signal reader automatically synchronizes its event to the main UI thread. If ThreadType is ThreadType.Timer then setting ThreadInvoking has no effect.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.ThreadType
member.summary: Gets/sets the way how data is generated. Generates data either using a thread or a main UI thread synchronized timer.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.OpenResult.UnknownExtension
member.summary: The extension is not one of the supported ones.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.OpenResult.UnknownWaveFormat
member.summary: WAV audio format must be PCM. Others will fail.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.OpenResult.LicenseError
member.summary: Installed license does not allow using SignalReader

member.summary: Enumaration of defined types of read sample bundles.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SignalReader.ReadSampleBundlesStatus.SamplesPartiallyReadEndOfFile
member.summary: Read samples partially, only end of file.

member.summary: Enumaration of defined validations of formats.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of SpectrumCalculator class.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateBackward(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates backwards FFT conversion. Converts frequency component data into signal sample data.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateBackward(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates backwards FFT conversion. Converts frequency component data into signal sample data.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateForward(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates FFT conversion. Converts signal data into frequency component data.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateForward(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates FFT conversion. Converts signal data into frequency component data.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrum(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrum(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrumOverlapped(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. Overlaps moving FFT window until all data is processed. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.
member.param: Overlapping percent. Moving FFT window is shifted by this amount for next calculation round. Valid values are 0...99
Output FFT data. Length equals fftWindowLenght. If samples length is less than fftWindowLength, outputs samples length of data.
Processed sample count. It is possible that all samples are not processed from the end, if there's not enough data for last FFT window.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.SignalProcessing.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrumOverlapped(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Double,System.Single[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. Overlaps moving FFT window until all data is processed. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.
member.param: Overlapping percent. Moving FFT window is shifted by this amount for next calculation round. Valid values are 0...99
Output FFT data. Length equals fftWindowLenght. If samples length is less than fftWindowLength, outputs samples length of data.
Processed sample count. It is possible that all samples are not processed from the end, if there's not enough data for last FFT window.

member.summary: Square wave symmetry. Valid range is 0...1. If symmetry is < 0.5, the 'low'stage of noise wave is longer than 'high' stage. Vice versa, value > 0.5 makes the 'high' stage longer
